(That, and no baby carrots.) The pickles and raw vegetables here keep things light before a heavy meal (as in, this pork roast, polenta, and red wine spaghetti), but feel free to mix and match depending on whatever’s your favorite. Serve with this creamy Pine Nut and White Bean Dip and zippy Pistachio and Mint Pesto. These recipes are all from Montreal’s cozy-cool coffee-pizza-wine restaurant Elena.Ingredients8–10 servings2–3lb. mixed raw vegetables (such as endive, cauliflower, carrots, radishes, and/or fennel), cut into bite-size pieces1–2lb. mixed pickled vegetables8oz. mortadella or other pork charcuterie, thinly slicedGrissini breadsticks, olives, and/or almonds (for serving)½lemonFlaky sea saltPistachio and Mint PestoPine Nut and White Bean DipPreparationArrange raw and pickled vegetables, mortadella, and breadsticks on a large platter in an aesthetically pleasing way. Squeeze lemon over raw vegetables; season with sea salt.
